intro: Lasiostyles, commonly known as the "spear-styles," are a genus of flowering plants in the family Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, elongated flowers that resemble small spears, hence their common name. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Lasiostyles typically grow as epiphytes or lithophytes, often found on tree trunks or rocks in humid environments. Their botanical significance lies in their specialized floral structures and their role in pollination by specific insect species.
